author: michael jeacock

comment:
Why would Forbes put that sentence in their article about Emilia Clarke selling her California home? Unless if other major trades also confirm it, then treat it with a grain of salt.

Anyways, WB really needs to do something about the whole Amber Heard situation and the public drama surrounding her and Johnny Depp had caused. If they had fired Johnny Depp, shouldn't they do the same for Amber Heard as well because the evidence of her being a domestic abuser is also there and I can imagine the awkward PR nightmare this may cause for the Aquaman 2 press junket because we all know that everyone will definitely be asking about the Amber Heard situation for sure. I wouldn't want to be either Jason Momoa or James Wan in that situation.

Okay, so going for the rhetorical question in mind, will a recast with Emilia Clarke as the new Mera be plausible? Well, unlike with Amber, there's definitely no drama with Emilia as she seems to be free of any personal drama and everyone who had worked with her before in the past really loved working with her so having someone like that on set would definitely boost morale and fans loved her despite the let down of the widely despised final season of GoT and her questionable film choices. Since her and Momoa already had the chemistry during their early Game of Thrones days, maybe they can try and replicate that for Aquaman 2? It would definitely help make things as smooth as possible for everyone.

Of course, the only downside with Emilia is that she's probably a bit too short compared to Momoa and would be a bit distracting of the height difference if they go ahead with the recasting? But then again, if she does great with Mera then I think people can forgive the height differences and just go along with it.
